results.clause_text: This document is a Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider) and the (customer), outlining the provisioning of IT services. The purpose of this agreement is to establish service expectations, identify provider and consumer responsibilities related to this service, specify how this service is supported, and clarify service charges.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the current wording is ignored, the business risk lies in the subtle ambiguity created by an introductory statement that primarily declares the overall purpose of the agreement rather than actively outlining or establishing these aspects within its own text. This could lead to minor interpretive disagreements regarding the foundational intent and scope of the Service Level Agreement, potentially requiring additional effort to ascertain the precise meaning of its introductory framework. While unlikely to cause direct financial loss, it represents a missed opportunity for greater clarity and precision at the agreement's outset, subtly increasing the potential for minor future disputes.
results.suggested_correction: This Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider) and the (customer) outlines the provisioning of IT services. It establishes the framework for service expectations, defines provider and consumer responsibilities regarding this service, specifies its support mechanisms, and clarifies all applicable service charges.
results.justification: The clause functions as an introductory statement for the entire Service Level Agreement, setting out its general subject matter and high-level objectives. While it refers to service expectations and responsibilities, its primary role is to broadly outline the 'provisioning of IT services' and the agreement's overarching goals. Crucially, the clause does not define measurable key performance indicators or specific performance standards, which are integral to a dedicated 'Service Levels' clause. Therefore, it is more accurately classified as a 'Scope of Services' clause, defining what the agreement will cover and the general parameters within which services will operate. The current drafting presents a minor weakness. The clause states 'The purpose of this agreement is to establish...' rather than directly establishing, identifying, specifying, or clarifying these elements within the clause itself. This creates a slightly self-referential or passive tone for an introductory statement, which ideally should actively set the stage for the agreement. While not severely impairing enforceability, as its function is primarily declarative of intent, this linguistic imprecision could lead to a low level of ambiguity in the foundational understanding of the contract's scope and objectives. The clause appears balanced in its general reference to both provider and consumer responsibilities. The reconciled risk score of 3.0 reflects this minor drafting weakness, acknowledging that while the clause performs its introductory function, it could be more precise and active in its language to enhance overall clarity without fundamentally altering its commercial intent or introducing new economic mechanisms.

results.clause_text: Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a service to customer. NUIT will: provide • Device deployment – Procurement, Custom factory image loading including enterprise licensed common applications, asset tagging and labelling, pre-delivery and staging services, and system installation, system configuration and data migrations. Delivers and installs your fully integrated systems to customer designated user locations. • Secure endpoint management - pre-configuration of security solutions and installation of antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions. Regular application of Operating system and application software patches. • Device Management - Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device lifecycle • NUIT Service Desk - represents the entry point and first-touch support process for all hardware and software service-related requests. NUIT delivers a strategic, customized full-featured service desk that is driven by the goals of quality, value, and customer satisfaction. NUIT service desk is accountable to resolve, track, escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer productivity. • NUIT provides on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and peripherals support. We assist with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well as everyday hardware and peripheral support services. Authorized service delivery providers will be dispatched to your End User when hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely. • Disposition and redeployment– NUIT delivers efficient, secure and simple processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes. Ensures that system data is destroyed for security purposes. Disposal of Assets and manages Employee Purchase Programs.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the identified weaknesses carries significant business risks, including potential scope creep where NUIT may be pressured to perform services beyond the agreed scope without additional compensation. The absence of clearly defined customer responsibilities can lead to delays, operational inefficiencies, and disputes if NUIT's performance is hindered by a lack of necessary customer cooperation, potentially causing project overruns and client dissatisfaction. Without a formal change control mechanism, adapting services to evolving business needs becomes an informal, uncontrolled process, exposing both parties to commercial disagreements over costs and scope adjustments. This lack of contractual precision can escalate into costly legal disputes, erode trust, and damage the long-term relationship between NUIT and the customer, ultimately impacting NUIT's profitability and reputation.
results.suggested_correction: Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a service to customer. Customer shall provide all reasonable cooperation and access necessary for NUIT to perform its obligations hereunder. NUIT will: provide • Device deployment – Procurement, Custom factory image loading including enterprise licensed common applications, asset tagging and labelling, pre-delivery and staging services, and system installation, system configuration and data migrations. Delivers and installs your fully integrated systems to customer designated user locations. • Secure endpoint management - pre-configuration of security solutions and installation of antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions. Regular application of Operating system and application software patches. • Device Management - Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device lifecycle • NUIT Service Desk - represents the entry point and first-touch support process for all hardware and software service-related requests. NUIT delivers a strategic, customized full-featured service desk that is driven by the goals of quality, value, and customer satisfaction. NUIT service desk is accountable to resolve, track, escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer productivity. • NUIT provides on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and peripherals support. We assist with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well as everyday hardware and peripheral support services. Authorized service delivery providers will be dispatched to your End User when hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely. • Disposition and redeployment– NUIT delivers efficient, secure and simple processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes. Ensures that system data is destroyed for security purposes. Disposal of Assets and manages Employee Purchase Programs. Services provided hereunder are strictly limited to those explicitly described. Any services not specifically detailed herein or any modifications to the scope of services shall be mutually agreed upon in writing by both parties.
results.justification: The original clause comprehensively details the IT services NUIT will provide, ranging from device deployment and secure management to service desk support and disposition, aligning with a Scope of Services clause. However, the clause presents an imbalance of obligations and significant commercial and enforceability risks due to critical omissions. While NUIT's responsibilities are clearly articulated, the clause fails to delineate the customer's corresponding obligations, such as providing necessary access, information, or timely approvals. This omission creates an enforceability risk, as NUIT's ability to perform could be hindered without explicit customer cooperation, leading to potential disputes over non-performance or delays. Commercially, this lack of clarity can result in NUIT bearing the burden of unstated customer inputs, increasing operational costs, and impacting service delivery efficiency. Furthermore, the clause does not define the boundaries of the service scope by explicitly stating what is excluded, which exposes NUIT to the risk of scope creep where unagreed services might be expected, leading to commercial exposure for work performed without compensation. The absence of a formal change control mechanism for modifying or adding services is another critical weakness. Without such a process, any evolution in service requirements would lack a structured contractual framework, potentially resulting in informal, undocumented changes, or protracted disputes over additional costs or scope adjustments. These omissions collectively elevate the clause's risk beyond minor drafting weaknesses, representing moderate ambiguity and limited exposure, thereby justifying a reconciled risk score of 4.0.

results.clause_text: The period of this agreement is September 1, 2019 through August 30, 2020. Each year, this agreement will automatically extend for one calendar year unless it is modified or terminated as described in this document.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Failure to diligently track the automatic renewal notice periods, which are referenced as being described elsewhere in the agreement, could result in unintended extended contractual commitments, unforeseen financial obligations, and missed opportunities for renegotiation of terms. This administrative oversight could expose the parties to liabilities beyond their intended scope.
results.suggested_correction: The initial term of this agreement shall commence on September 1, 2019 and shall continue through August 30, 2020. Thereafter, this agreement shall automatically extend for successive one (1) year periods unless earlier terminated or modified in accordance with the terms of this agreement.
results.justification: The clause clearly establishes an initial contract period and provides for automatic annual extension. This automatic renewal mechanism is enforceable but inherently creates an administrative burden for both parties, necessitating diligent tracking of notice periods to avoid unintended extensions or renewals. While the clause explicitly references modification or termination conditions "as described in this document," indicating that a comprehensive understanding of the termination landscape requires review of other sections of the agreement, this cross-reference does not constitute a drafting weakness in this specific clause. Rather, it signifies a dependency on other contractual provisions. There is no inherent imbalance of obligations within the clause itself, as the automatic extension mechanism would apply equally to both parties unless stated otherwise in the referenced modification or termination provisions. The primary commercial exposure stems from the potential for administrative oversight in managing these automatic renewals, which could lead to unwanted extended commitments, financial obligations, or missed opportunities to renegotiate terms. This practical risk, though not a fundamental enforceability issue with the clause's core language, elevates the score to reflect the need for active management to prevent unintended consequences.

results.clause_text: Maintenance of services provided in this agreement will be conducted in accordance with established NUIT Change Management practices, and will occur during scheduled service maintenance windows. Emergency maintenance, in response to service outages, may occur with no advanced notice to service consumers. Maintenance or outages of other, underlying or integrated, services may impact the services provided in this agreement. Notification of service maintenance and outages is available at: Service Status (https://service-status.northwestern.edu/). Information on how to subscribe to email service alerts can be found at: https://service-status.northwestern.edu/
results.justification: All models agree this clause is not a golden clause.

results.clause_text: The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT will be responsible for the following: Workstations (desktop and laptop computers) • Build workstations Install one of NUIT approved computer images o  Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems will be assessed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on a case by case basis based on business, research or teaching need. Install additional software and or make additional updates to the endpoint device o  Upon request  Subject to security approval Include and manage o  NUIT’ service automated software updating services (Kace/ JAMF)  Endpoint security software(Symantec Endpoint Protection)  Whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault) Ensure desired work space has functional electrical and network access o  Make recommendations for electrical or network access and advise CONDUITS and FM ordering processes. Purchase, deliver and install workstation in desired work space o Troubleshooting wired or wireless network connectivity users, escalating to TNS has required. • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o  Coordinate with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for services (PCs)  Coordinate with Apple service technician (MACs) Provide temporary loaner computer o  Upon request  If operationally necessary  Subject to availability Conference room and classroom support o  Coordinate with Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as need for support issue • Provide departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for workstations. • Assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers • Provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g. Windows “Creator Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases) • Provide disposition of end-of-life devices Scrub data and remove hard drive o Send devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donate to Student Enrichment Services Mobile Devices The following support is offered upon request: • Make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University owned mobile device • Configure mobile devise • Configure email • Coordinate activities with 3rd party vendors as required (University owned devices only) • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required (University owned devices only) Printers The following support is offered upon request: • Set up printers • Organize for disposal of printers OU Administration (CampusAD) The following support is offered upon request: • Add new users to CampusAD • Create CampusAD accounts • Grant access to resources control via CampusAD • Delete users • Manage Group Policies Endpoint Management Services Management of the following endpoint management software’s: • Workstations will be patched no less than monthly for OS and application by use of management software, including Kace, JAMF • Full system backup of device including local machine stored data using Crashplan Monitoring of backup services will be provided, with either tickets generated o or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning Box The following support is offered upon request: • Install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync • Facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts Multi-function devices The following support is offered upon request: • Configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device. • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o Installation and Troubleshooting of customer specific software The following support is offered upon request: • Northwestern IT will install all customer specific software and will work with the user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not destabilize other desktop or application functionality • NUIT will work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to accomplish same, but will not act independently of the user/experts in contacting vendors. Out of Scope The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA. • Management of personal devices • Support for unmanaged devices such as servers, customer purchased devices New Technology Both Northwestern IT and the customer recognize that new technology adoption is important to the mission of the university. The customer may be introduced or considered for adoption during the course of this Agreement. At the mutual agreement of the NUIT and the customer, joint testing, demonstration, or evaluation of such technology may be undertaken. If the customer adopts a new computing technology and desires that NUIT support it, then the Customer Contact will consult with the TSS. If they agree that the new technology has a limited effect on support time for the support personnel, then it will be incorporated into the current support activities. Otherwise, the Customer Contact will follow the procedure described in the section entitled “Support Outside of this Agreement”. Computer Support Policies Northwestern IT will support the University-owned computers of the customer based on the following policies: 1. New purchases must meet the Northwestern IT recommended standards. New purchases will be set up with the NUIT software image. 2. Existing computer hardware must meet the minimum hardware and operating system standards. 3. Support level will be determined by the age of the machine Computer Age Support level Support description 0-4 years Full Support Northwestern IT will ensure the working order of the computer, using reasonable staff time and support resources 4-5 years Best Effort Northwestern IT will spend up to one hour fixing an issue. If the issue cannot be resolved at that time, NUIT will recommend replacing the computer and facilitate the recovery/transfer of data. 5 years or Out of Support Northwestern IT will facilitate the recovery/transfer of older data, but will not attempt to resolve technical issues. Legacy Computers connected to instruments • Best effort support will be provided to computers connected to research equipment in consultation with Northwestern IT’s Information Security Office • Legacy equipment may need to be placed off network to avoid remote exploit or other risk
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the identified weaknesses could lead to significant operational disruptions due to conditional or discretionary service delivery by NUIT, such as delays in software installation subject to security approvals or the lack of guaranteed loaner computers. The cumbersome process for new technology adoption could hinder innovation and force the customer to operate unsupported systems, impacting productivity and security. The age-based support policy, with its 'best effort' and 'out of support' tiers for older hardware, may necessitate unplanned capital expenditures for early equipment replacement to maintain full operational capability. Furthermore, the risk of legacy equipment being required to be placed off-network could disrupt critical research or operational functions reliant on those systems, while retaining them on-network without adequate support poses ongoing security vulnerabilities. Overall, the customer faces a lack of clear service entitlements and an inability to reliably plan for IT support, creating uncertainty and potential for unbudgeted costs and operational inefficiencies.
results.suggested_correction: The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT shall be responsible for the following: Workstations (desktop and laptop computers) • Build workstations Install one of NUIT approved computer images o  Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems shall be reviewed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on a case-by-case basis, considering business, research, or teaching need. Install additional software or make additional updates to the endpoint device o  Upon request  Subject to NUIT's standard security approval process. Include and manage o  NUIT’s automated software updating services (Kace/ JAMF)  Endpoint security software (Symantec Endpoint Protection)  Whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault) • Ensure desired work space has functional electrical and network access o  Make recommendations for electrical or network access and advise CONDUITS and FM ordering processes. • Purchase, deliver and install workstation in desired work space • Troubleshooting wired or wireless network connectivity for users, escalating to TNS as required. • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o  Coordinate with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for services (PCs)  Coordinate with Apple service technician (MACs) • NUIT shall endeavor to provide a temporary loaner computer o  Upon request o  If operationally necessary o  Subject to availability • Conference room and classroom support o  Coordinate with Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as needed for support issues. • Provide departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for workstations. • Assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers • Provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g. Windows “Creator Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases) • Provide disposition of end-of-life devices Scrub data and remove hard drive o Send devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donate to Student Enrichment Services Mobile Devices The following support is offered upon request: • Make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University owned mobile device • Configure mobile device • Configure email • Coordinate activities with 3rd party vendors as required (University owned devices only) • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required (University owned devices only) Printers The following support is offered upon request: • Set up printers • Organize for disposal of printers OU Administration (CampusAD) The following support is offered upon request: • Add new users to CampusAD • Create CampusAD accounts • Grant access to resources control via CampusAD • Delete users • Manage Group Policies Endpoint Management Services Management of the following endpoint management software: • Workstations shall be patched no less than monthly for OS and application by use of management software, including Kace, JAMF • Full system backup of device including local machine stored data using Crashplan Monitoring of backup services shall be provided, with either tickets generated o or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning. Box The following support is offered upon request: • Install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync • Facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts Multi-function devices The following support is offered upon request: • Configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device. • Address user observed errors upon notification Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts o Coordinate warranty work as required o Installation and Troubleshooting of customer specific software The following support is offered upon request: • Northwestern IT shall install all customer specific software and shall work with the user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not destabilize other desktop or application functionality. • NUIT shall work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to accomplish same, but shall not act independently of the user/experts in contacting vendors. Out of Scope The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA. • Management of personal devices • Support for unmanaged devices such as servers, customer purchased devices New Technology Both Northwestern IT and the customer recognize that new technology adoption is important to the mission of the university. The customer may be introduced to or consider new technology for adoption during the course of this Agreement. NUIT and the customer shall collaborate to evaluate new technology through joint testing, demonstration, or evaluation as mutually agreed. If the customer adopts a new computing technology and requests NUIT's support, the Customer Contact shall consult with the Technology Support Services (TSS) Director. NUIT shall assess the impact of supporting the new technology on its support personnel and operational resources. If NUIT determines that the new technology can be supported within existing service parameters, it shall be incorporated into the current support activities. Otherwise, the Customer Contact shall follow the procedure described in the section entitled “Support Outside of this Agreement”. Computer Support Policies Northwestern IT shall support the University-owned computers of the customer based on the following policies: 1. New purchases must meet the Northwestern IT recommended standards. New purchases shall be set up with the NUIT software image. 2. Existing computer hardware must meet the minimum hardware and operating system standards. 3. Support level shall be determined by the age of the machine Computer Age Support level Support description 0-4 years Full Support Northwestern IT shall ensure the working order of the computer, using reasonable staff time and support resources. 4-5 years Best Effort Northwestern IT shall spend up to one hour fixing an issue. If the issue cannot be resolved within that time, NUIT shall recommend replacing the computer and shall facilitate the recovery/transfer of data. 5 years or Out of Support Northwestern IT shall facilitate the recovery/transfer of older data, but shall not attempt to resolve technical issues. Legacy Computers connected to instruments • Best effort support shall be provided to computers connected to research equipment in consultation with Northwestern IT’s Information Security Office. • Legacy equipment may be required to be placed off network by NUIT to mitigate remote exploit or other security risks.
results.justification: This clause is accurately classified as a Scope of Services clause due to its comprehensive detailing of NUIT's responsibilities and the services provided, along with clearly defined out-of-scope items. This high level of detail inherently reduces ambiguity regarding what services are covered. However, the clause exhibits a significant imbalance of obligations, leaning heavily in favor of NUIT, which impacts the enforceability of many stated services as firm commitments rather than conditional entitlements. For instance, services are frequently made 'subject to security approval,' 'subject to availability,' or contingent on 'case-by-case' assessment, such as for dual-booting systems or loaner computers. The process for new technology adoption is also highly discretionary, requiring 'mutual agreement' and NUIT's assessment of support impact, which can impede innovation or leave new technologies unsupported. The age-based computer support policies, transitioning from 'Full Support' to 'Best Effort' and then 'Out of Support' for older machines, clearly delineate NUIT's diminishing responsibility over time. While these limitations are explicitly stated, they introduce substantial operational and commercial exposure for the customer, as services are not guaranteed without further NUIT discretion or specific conditions being met. The clarity of these limitations mitigates legal risk around misinterpretation of scope but elevates the operational and commercial risks associated with service delivery. The reconciled risk score of 6.0 reflects that while the clause is clear in its definitions, the numerous discretionary conditions and service limitations create significant enforceability gaps for the customer's expected service levels and an imbalance in the allocation of operational risks.

results.clause_text: The following list contains the customer’s responsibilities related to their use of this service: General • Submit requests for services to the IT Support Center (by email, phone, or self-service ticket entry) • Submit notification of service interruptions or reductions to the IT Support Center • Provide funding for the purchase of any equipment covered by this SLA • Provide a list of the devices and their serial numbers for each device covered by this SLA: Initial list will be provided from Kace export o Updates and changes to support environment will be managed in Kace, or its replacement for asset management • Notify NUIT of devices to be added to the SLA throughout the year through the new computer request form Workstations • Arrange to refresh workstations within four years of purchase • Provide funding for the refresh purchase Printers • Purchase a service warranty for each University owned printer that includes break-fix and full replacement
results.business_risk_if_ignored: The customer faces significant unmitigated financial exposure due to direct obligations to fund all equipment purchases, workstation refreshes, and printer service warranties. Operationally, the extensive responsibility for managing device lists, updates, and arranging refreshes places a substantial administrative burden on the customer, risking internal resource strain and potential service disruptions if not meticulously managed. If these unilateral obligations are ignored, the customer could experience escalating and uncontrolled expenditures, increased administrative overhead, and potential disputes with the service provider regarding unreciprocated duties, ultimately jeopardizing the smooth delivery and support of the service.
results.suggested_correction: The Customer shall be responsible for the following in connection with its use of the Service: General: The Customer shall submit requests for services to the IT Support Center (by email, phone, or self-service ticket entry). The Customer shall submit notification of service interruptions or reductions to the IT Support Center. The Customer shall provide funding for the purchase of any equipment required for and covered by this SLA. The Customer shall provide and maintain a current list of devices and their serial numbers for each device covered by this SLA. The initial list shall be provided from Kace export. The Customer shall manage updates and changes to the support environment within Kace, or its replacement asset management system. The Customer shall notify NUIT of devices to be added to the SLA throughout the year through the new computer request form. Workstations: The Customer shall arrange for the refresh of workstations within four years of their purchase. The Customer shall provide funding for such refresh purchases. Printers: The Customer shall purchase a service warranty for each University-owned printer covered by this SLA that includes break-fix and full replacement.
results.justification: This clause comprehensively outlines numerous specific responsibilities and obligations for the customer regarding the use of the service. These responsibilities include critical financial undertakings, such as providing funding for equipment purchases, workstation refreshes, and printer service warranties, alongside significant operational duties like submitting service requests, managing device updates, and notifying additions to the SLA. While the clause is clear in its enumeration of these duties, it presents a substantial imbalance by exclusively detailing the customer's obligations without specifying any reciprocal duties or performance standards for the service provider within the clause itself. This unilateral allocation places considerable commercial and operational exposure on the customer. Commercially, the customer is exposed to potentially uncapped or undefined costs related to hardware acquisition, maintenance, and lifecycle management, all of which are fundamental to the service's functionality. Operationally, the burden of managing and updating device lists, refreshing workstations, and ensuring warranty coverage requires significant internal resources, potentially disrupting the customer's own operations if not managed meticulously. The enforceability risk arises not from ambiguity in the listed customer duties, but from the potential for disputes when the customer perceives a lack of corresponding provider performance, or when the financial and operational burdens become unexpectedly high, without a clear contractual framework for sharing or mitigating these risks. The reconciled risk score of 6.5 reflects this significant imbalance and the high commercial and operational exposure for the customer, arising from extensive and unreciprocated obligations.

results.clause_text: This service agreement assumes the following: • NUIT will bill Customer for support activity outside of the scope of this agreement at a standard service rate • Overtime work will be charged at 150% of the standard rate • After hours support work that requires support personal to return to work will include a minimum charge of three hours
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If ignored, the Customer faces significant exposure to unpredictable and escalating service costs due to the lack of clearly defined billing parameters. Disputes are highly probable concerning what constitutes 'out of scope' work, the applicable 'standard service rate,' and the triggers for 'overtime' and 'after-hours' charges. This ambiguity places the Customer at a distinct disadvantage, as NUIT could unilaterally interpret these terms, leading to unexpected financial burdens and strained commercial relations. Furthermore, the enforceability of such charges could be challenged, leading to potential legal costs and delays.
results.suggested_correction: NUIT shall bill Customer for support activity falling outside the scope of services as defined in this Agreement, at the Standard Service Rate as defined in this Agreement. Overtime work shall be charged at 150% of the Standard Service Rate. After-hours support work that requires NUIT personnel to return to work shall include a minimum charge equivalent to three hours at the Standard Service Rate.
results.justification: This clause, which sets forth billing terms for out-of-scope work, overtime, and after-hours support, presents significant enforceability risks primarily due to the repeated reliance on undefined terms. The 'standard service rate' is not specified, nor is the precise meaning of 'outside of the scope of this agreement,' 'overtime work,' or 'after hours support work that requires support personal to return to work.' This fundamental lack of definition creates substantial ambiguity, making it challenging to determine the exact financial obligations and triggers for additional charges. The commercial exposure for the customer is considerable; without a clear standard rate and defined triggers, the customer is vulnerable to unpredictable and potentially substantial costs, with little ability to budget or dispute charges effectively. The clause is notably imbalanced, as it exclusively outlines mechanisms for the service provider to levy additional fees without corresponding customer protections, defined limits, or explicit consent mechanisms for these charges. This one-sided nature, coupled with the inherent ambiguities, elevates the risk of disputes and financial surprises. The specified 150% overtime rate and the three-hour minimum charge for after-hours work, while commercially standard in principle, become problematic and potentially unenforceable when the underlying definitions and standard rates are absent. The reconciled risk score of 7.0 reflects this significant enforceability gap, the high financial and operational exposure for the customer, and the clear imbalance in obligations.

results.clause_text: Support tickets, pertaining to service incidents (break-fix) and requests, should be submitted via the NUIT Service Desk and include the following information: • Customer contact information including: name, phone number, email address • Brief description of the service issue • Priority level of the incident or request The Service Desk staff will provide first level support to resolve the issue. Issues that are not resolved at first level will be escalated to Tier 2 support teams for resolution. Telephone calls received by the Service Desk outside of scheduled support hours will prompt callers to leave a message or page support staff for emergencies. The voice messages will be responded to on next business day. Customers are encouraged to check the NUIT Service Status web site https://service-status.northwestern.edu/ for scheduled maintenance events and service alerts. Hours Contact Information Days of operation Monday – 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM Phone: (847) 491-4357 Friday (1-HELP) Service Desk https://www.it.northwestern.edu/supportcenter/index.html Saturday Not Available Sunday Not Available Summer Hours Monday – Friday 8:00 am – 5:00pm CLOSED: Winter/Spring Break, University holidays
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the specific support procedures and stated availability commitments outlined in this clause could lead to operational inefficiencies, delays in issue resolution, and user dissatisfaction. Failure to meet these defined service parameters, such as response times or availability, could constitute a breach of service terms, potentially impacting customer trust and service continuity, albeit without immediate severe financial or legal penalties, given the low risk nature of the clause.
results.suggested_correction: Support tickets pertaining to service incidents (break-fix) and requests shall be submitted via the NUIT Service Desk and shall include: customer contact information (name, phone number, email address), a brief description of the service issue, and the priority level of the incident or request. The Service Desk staff shall provide first level support. Issues not resolved at first level shall be escalated to Tier 2 support teams for resolution. Telephone calls received by the Service Desk outside of scheduled support hours shall prompt callers to leave a message or page support staff for emergencies; voice messages shall be responded to on the next business day. The NUIT Service Desk operates during the following hours: Monday – Friday, 8:00 AM – 6:00 PM (academic year) and Monday – Friday, 8:00 AM – 5:00 PM (summer hours). The Service Desk shall be closed on Winter/Spring Break and University holidays.
results.justification: This clause establishes clear operational procedures for submitting support tickets and, more significantly, defines specific service availability and response commitments. These commitments include specified operating hours and days, a defined response expectation for messages left outside normal hours ('responded to on next business day'), and declared periods of service unavailability (e.g., 'CLOSED: Winter/Spring Break, University holidays'). While presented procedurally, these elements create binding service level obligations, classifying this as a Service Levels clause. Failure to adhere to these defined availability and response parameters would constitute a breach of the service terms, potentially impacting customer operations and satisfaction. The clause is balanced as it clearly outlines the scope and limitations of the support service being offered, setting clear expectations for the customer without imposing disproportionate obligations on either party. The reconciled risk score of 3.0 is justified because, while the clause clearly articulates these operational commitments, the exposure stems from the potential for service disruptions or unmet expectations if these specific timeframes and conditions are not met, leading to minor operational or reputational impact, but not severe financial or legal penalties typically associated with higher risk scores.

results.clause_text: All incident tickets are assessed for customer impact and urgency to determine priority. A predefined Incident priority matrix is used as guidance in assessing incident priority. Priority Target Target Response Resolution Time Time Critical Immediate 2 Hour (P1) High 15 Minutes 8 Hours (P2) Medium 15 Minutes 24 Hours (P3) Low 4 Business 3 Business Days (P4) Hours NUIT aims to meet these targets 80% or more over a period of calendar month. ** We expect to provide a 15-minute response time and 2-hour target resolution time for all incidents or requests received from deans, director and chairs, and their designated assistants with a 90% of higher compliance target.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the aspirational language in the clause remains uncorrected, the client will have no contractual basis to legally enforce the stated response and resolution times, nor the associated compliance targets. This means that despite clear expectations for service performance, the service provider could consistently fail to meet these times without being in breach of contract. This exposes the client to significant operational disruptions, potentially delayed resolution of critical issues, reduced productivity across the institution, and reputational damage, particularly if high-priority stakeholders such as deans, directors, and chairs do not receive the explicitly expected preferential service. The commercial value and reliability derived from having defined service level targets are effectively negated, as the client cannot compel performance or seek appropriate remedies for non-performance.
results.suggested_correction: All incident tickets are assessed for customer impact and urgency to determine priority. A predefined Incident priority matrix is used as guidance in assessing incident priority. Priority Target Target Response Resolution Time Time Critical Immediate 2 Hour (P1) High 15 Minutes 8 Hours (P2) Medium 15 Minutes 24 Hours (P3) Low 4 Business 3 Business Days (P4) Hours. NUIT shall meet these response and resolution time targets for all incidents (P1-P4) in at least 80% of cases over each calendar month. For all incidents or requests received from deans, directors, chairs, and their designated assistants, NUIT shall provide a 15-minute response time and a 2-hour resolution time, achieving a compliance target of 90% or higher.
results.justification: The clause defines specific incident priority levels, target response and resolution times, and quantifiable compliance targets (80% and 90%), clearly aligning it with a Service Levels clause. However, the language used, specifically 'NUIT aims to meet these targets' and 'We expect to provide,' is aspirational rather than contractually binding. This significantly weakens the provider's commitment to these service levels, rendering them difficult, if not impossible, to enforce contractually. For a clause purporting to set service levels, this constitutes a major enforceability gap, as the targets do not establish a definite obligation. Furthermore, the clause lacks any explicit mention of remedies, service credits, or penalties for failure to meet these stated targets, which creates substantial commercial and operational exposure for the client by removing any specific consequence for non-performance. While the clause sets high expectations, especially for certain individuals with a 90% compliance target, these expectations cannot be enforced as binding obligations without operative language. The reconciled risk score of 7.5 reflects this significant enforceability deficiency and the substantial commercial risk the client faces by not being able to compel performance or seek recourse for missed targets, despite their explicit definition.

results.clause_text: Request Priority Response Time Resolution Time High 1 Business Hour 1 Business day Medium, 4 Business Hours 3 Business days Low 8 Business Hours 5 Business days NUIT aims to meet these targets 80% or more over a period of calendar month.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause remains uncorrected, the client faces substantial operational and commercial exposure. The current drafting uses aspirational language, stating that NUIT 'aims to meet' the specified service targets. This renders the service levels non-binding and effectively unenforceable, despite the clear enumeration of response and resolution times. Consequently, if NUIT consistently fails to meet these targets, the client will have no contractual recourse to demand performance or seek remedies. This lack of a binding commitment can lead to prolonged service disruptions, impaired operational efficiency, potential financial losses due to downtime, and a significant imbalance where the service provider is not contractually obligated to perform to the stated standards, shifting all performance risk to the client.
results.suggested_correction: Request Priority Response Time Resolution Time High 1 Business Hour 1 Business day Medium, 4 Business Hours 3 Business days Low 8 Business Hours 5 Business days. NUIT shall meet or exceed these targets for 80% or more of applicable requests over a calendar month.
results.justification: This clause defines specific response and resolution times based on priority, along with a quantifiable performance target, which aligns with the characteristics of a Service Levels clause. However, the clause contains a critical drafting weakness that renders the stated service levels largely ineffective as a binding commitment. The use of the phrase 'NUIT aims to meet these targets' makes the performance objectives aspirational rather than contractually obligatory. This aspirational language significantly weakens the enforceability of these service levels, as it provides no clear basis for the client to claim breach of contract should the targets consistently go unmet. The commercial exposure stemming from this lack of binding commitment is high, as the client would have no legal recourse for non-performance, potentially leading to service degradation without any contractual remedy. Furthermore, the absence of any specified remedies or service credits for failure to meet these targets exacerbates the imbalance of obligations, heavily favoring the service provider. The service provider is essentially insulated from accountability for failing to meet the stated service levels. Therefore, the risk score is assessed at 8.0, reflecting a high level of financial and operational exposure due to the lack of contractual enforceability and imbalance of obligations.

results.clause_text: NUIT Service Desk function will aim to meet the following target conditions for key performance metrics. • 80% of calls answered or abandoned within 30 seconds (Service Level) Average • Speed of Answer: 30 seconds or less • Abandon Rate: 5-8% • First call resolution rate: 65% • Customer satisfaction rate: 85%
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If this clause remains uncorrected, the party relying on the NUIT Service Desk's performance faces significant commercial exposure. The aspirational language means the service provider has no binding obligation to meet the stated performance targets. Consequently, consistent failure to achieve these metrics, leading to degraded service quality, increased operational friction, potential reputational damage, and financial losses due to inefficient support, would not constitute a breach of contract. The reliant party would lack legal recourse to enforce performance, demand improvements, or seek compensation for service failures, leaving them unilaterally exposed to underperformance without contractual remedy.
results.suggested_correction: NUIT Service Desk function shall meet the following service levels: 80% of calls answered or abandoned within 30 seconds (Service Level) Average; Speed of Answer: 30 seconds or less; Abandon Rate: 5-8%; First call resolution rate: 65%; Customer satisfaction rate: 85%.
results.justification: The clause, while detailing specific performance metrics, suffers from a fundamental enforceability gap due to its aspirational language. Phrases such as "will aim to meet" and "target conditions" clearly indicate goals rather than firm, contractually binding obligations. This significantly weakens the clause, transforming what appear to be measurable service level commitments into mere aspirations. Consequently, the party receiving the service has no legal basis to compel performance if the NUIT Service Desk fails to achieve these stated metrics, nor is there any explicit mechanism for remedy, such as service credits or termination rights, for such underperformance. This creates a substantial commercial exposure for the reliant party, as they face the risk of service degradation, operational disruption, and potential financial losses without contractual recourse. The clause is notably imbalanced; it provides the service provider with broad discretion while imposing no tangible obligation to meet the published standards, leaving the customer vulnerable to unaddressed service failures. This structural weakness in enforceability and the resultant one-sided risk allocation justify a risk score reflecting significant enforceability gaps and imbalance.

results.clause_text: In the event of an ongoing service level breach, NUIT will perform a root cause analysis and present options to review and determine appropriate steps to mitigate, which could include increasing staffing levels, process adjustments, or other remediation steps.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: The client faces significant commercial and operational exposure from prolonged service level breaches without clear, enforceable remedies or defined timelines for resolution. The absence of specific obligations for NUIT to implement determined mitigation steps or achieve a timely resolution leaves the client vulnerable to continued service degradation, impacting business operations, customer satisfaction, and potentially incurring financial losses without contractual recourse.
results.suggested_correction: In the event of an ongoing service level breach, NUIT shall promptly perform a root cause analysis and present its proposed mitigation options to the Client within five (5) business days. Following mutual agreement on appropriate steps to mitigate the breach, NUIT shall diligently implement such steps without undue delay, which may include increasing staffing levels, process adjustments, or other remediation measures.
results.justification: The clause requires NUIT to perform a root cause analysis and present options for mitigation but lacks specific, enforceable obligations regarding the resolution of the breach or remedies for the client. The phrase 'present options to review and determine appropriate steps' is vague; it does not specify who determines these 'appropriate steps' or bind NUIT to implement them effectively within a defined timeframe. This creates a significant enforceability gap for the client, who is left without clear recourse or protection in the face of ongoing service degradation. Commercially, this exposes the client to prolonged service outages or performance issues without any contractual mechanism for compensation, service credits, or the right to terminate for persistent non-performance. The clause is imbalanced as it outlines the provider's internal process without corresponding, enforceable client rights or remedies. This lack of clear accountability and defined resolution paths, coupled with the absence of financial recourse or termination options, represents a significant legal and commercial exposure for the client, justifying a risk score of 7.0.

results.clause_text: During periods of multiple simultaneous service requests, NUIT will allocate resources in accordance with the following criteria: 1. High impact services (Mission Critical) 2. High volume services 3. Production services (opposed to training, quality assurance, test, development) 4. Time sensitive services 5. Other services
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring this clause's deficiencies creates substantial operational and commercial exposure. For clients, it introduces significant uncertainty regarding service delivery for any request not explicitly categorized as a top priority. Services deemed 'Other services' face potential indefinite delays without clear recourse, specific service level commitments, or remedies, leading to operational disruptions, missed deadlines, and potentially financial losses. The lack of objective definitions for 'High impact,' 'High volume,' or 'Time sensitive' means that NUIT retains unilateral control over prioritization, which can lead to a misalignment with client expectations and critical business needs. This imbalance of obligations places the full burden of resource contention onto the client, potentially damaging the commercial relationship and NUIT's reputation for reliable service delivery.
results.suggested_correction: During periods of multiple simultaneous service requests, NUIT shall allocate resources in accordance with the following criteria, applied sequentially: 1. Mission Critical Services, which are services jointly identified by the parties as essential to core business operations. 2. High Volume Services, which are services experiencing demand significantly exceeding typical operational capacity. 3. Production Services, which are services supporting live operational environments, excluding development, testing, training, or quality assurance. 4. Time Sensitive Services, which are services with defined, contractually agreed timelines. 5. Other Services, which shall be addressed in a reasonable timeframe following the resolution of higher priority requests, and NUIT shall notify affected parties of expected delays for services falling under this criterion.
results.justification: The clause outlines the service provider's unilateral criteria for resource allocation during periods of high demand, classifying it as a Service Levels clause due to its direct impact on service delivery and performance expectations. The principal enforceability risk arises from the pervasive ambiguity of the prioritization criteria. Terms such as 'High impact,' 'High volume,' and 'Time sensitive' lack objective definitions, allowing NUIT to retain sole discretion in their interpretation, which can lead to disputes and a misalignment with client expectations. The 'Other services' category presents significant commercial exposure for clients, as it implies potential indefinite delays for services not falling into higher priority tiers, without any compensatory mechanisms, clear response times, or defined remedies. This structure creates a significant imbalance of obligations, heavily favoring NUIT by permitting it to manage its resource contention at the potential expense of client service quality and operational continuity for non-critical requests. The clause as currently drafted offers insufficient clarity and protection for the client, justifying a high risk score due to the significant operational and commercial uncertainties and the potential for service disruptions without effective recourse.

results.clause_text: This Agreement represents the entire agreement between the customer and NUIT and supersedes all prior negotiations or agreements, written or oral, which are not included herein. This Agreement may only be amended by written instructions executed by the customer and NUIT. Either party may end this agreement by providing 90 days written notice. All customer assets, in the form of data or otherwise, related to this agreement must be obtained by the customer before or on the date of termination.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the clause is ignored, the customer faces a substantial risk of losing critical business data and other assets upon termination. The absence of a clear, reciprocal obligation for NUIT to facilitate or assist with asset retrieval by the hard deadline of the termination date places the entire burden and risk on the customer. This could lead to operational disruption, inability to transition services, or significant financial losses if essential data cannot be accessed or migrated in time. Disputes may arise over NUIT's post-termination responsibilities, and without explicit terms, the customer might have no recourse if NUIT fails to cooperate or if assets are deleted after the deadline, potentially causing long-term business impact.
results.suggested_correction: This Agreement represents the entire agreement between the customer and NUIT and supersedes all prior negotiations or agreements, written or oral, which are not included herein. This Agreement may only be amended by written instructions executed by the customer and NUIT. Either party may end this agreement by providing 90 days written notice. NUIT shall make all customer assets, in the form of data or otherwise, related to this agreement available for retrieval by the customer. The customer shall retrieve all such assets before or on the effective date of termination, and NUIT shall have no obligation to retain such assets thereafter.
results.justification: This clause is a composite, containing standard entire agreement and amendment provisions, along with termination for convenience and a post-termination obligation regarding customer assets. The entire agreement and amendment provisions are boilerplate and carry minimal legal risk. The mutual right to terminate with 90 days' written notice is balanced and provides adequate time for transition, presenting low enforceability risk. However, the clause creates a significant imbalance and potential commercial exposure concerning the retrieval of customer assets. It unilaterally imposes an obligation on the customer to obtain 'all customer assets, in the form of data or otherwise, related to this agreement... before or on the date of termination,' without specifying any corresponding duty for NUIT to facilitate this retrieval, ensure availability, or define a clear process. This ambiguity creates a risk that NUIT may not actively cooperate, or that practical challenges in retrieving large volumes of data within the 90-day period could lead to the customer's inability to meet the deadline. The clause is silent on the consequences of non-retrieval, implicitly suggesting forfeiture or deletion, which represents a substantial commercial risk for the customer. This lack of reciprocal obligation and process clarity significantly impacts the customer's operational continuity and data security. The reconciled risk score of 5.5 reflects this moderate exposure, acknowledging that while the core termination right is balanced, the post-termination asset management provision introduces material one-sided risk and potential for dispute or loss.

results.clause_text: Support under this agreement is recognized as a cooperative effort between customer, and Northwestern IT. The expertise Northwestern IT is providing is support for only the items outlined in this agreement. Should the customer determine there is a need for support for any items not specifically outlined in this agreement; the following procedure should be followed: A request should be made, in writing or in electronic form, to NUIT outlining the service requested. Note: requests for additional services should not be made to support personnel on site. Northwestern IT will create a proposal to deliver the service, detailing any new fees if incremental staff or services are required, and forward it to customer for review. Once approved by customer the proposal will be set forth as an addendum to this Agreement or as a new agreement if the requested services are foreign to the intentions of this Agreement.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: If the clause remains uncorrected, the business risks are primarily minor procedural ambiguities and less formal enforceability. The current language, while functionally clear in its intent to manage scope and change, lacks the imperative 'shall' for obligations and includes informal notes. This could lead to slight friction or minor disputes regarding procedural adherence or the precise enforceability of certain steps in a contentious scenario, potentially causing delays or necessitating more interpretation. However, the core mechanism for preventing scope creep and ensuring compensation for additional work is present and largely effective, so the direct financial or operational exposure remains low.
results.suggested_correction: Northwestern IT shall provide support only for the items specifically outlined in this Agreement. Should Customer require support for any items not specifically outlined herein, Customer shall submit a request in writing or in electronic form to Northwestern IT, detailing the service required. For clarity, requests for additional services shall not be made directly to on-site support personnel. Northwestern IT shall then create a proposal for such requested service, detailing any new fees if incremental staff or services are required, and shall submit it to Customer for review and approval. Upon Customer's written approval, the proposal shall be set forth as an addendum to this Agreement or as a new agreement if the requested services are outside the scope of this Agreement.
results.justification: This clause effectively defines the initial scope of support, clearly limiting it to items outlined in the agreement, thereby preventing unauthorized scope expansion. Crucially, it establishes a formal, multi-step process for handling requests for additional services: a written request from the customer, followed by a proposal from Northwestern IT detailing new fees, and finally mutual approval for inclusion as an addendum or a new agreement. This structured approach is a robust mechanism against scope creep, ensuring any expansion of services is mutually agreed upon and properly compensated. While an interpretation might suggest an 'onus on the customer' for initiation, this formal request process is a standard and effective risk management control, designed to clarify expectations and responsibilities for both parties, rather than creating an imbalance or significant exposure. The enforceability of the core mechanisms for scope control and change management is strong. Commercial exposure for both parties is well-managed as any new work is subject to a formal proposal and approval, mitigating risks related to uncompensated effort or unexpected charges. The current drafting weakness is minor, primarily related to verbosity and less formal language, rather than fundamental enforceability gaps or significant commercial exposure. Thus, the risk score is low, reflecting the clause's effective mitigation of typical service scope challenges through clear procedural definition.

results.clause_text: Customer (Major Administration Unit): Fiscal Officer: Phone number: Email: Account: Sub Account:
results.justification: All models agree this clause is not a golden clause.

results.clause_text: The below cost model only applies if there is not an existing Memorandum of Understanding. If a signed MOU exists please refer to that for the cost of agreement. Workstations: $525/year Mobile Devices $525/year Printers: No Charge (Limit one printer per workstation) Multi-function Devices: No Charge (Limit one multi-function device per workstation) Devices added mid-year prorated based upon applicable annual service charge for device.
results.business_risk_if_ignored: Ignoring the identified weaknesses exposes the business to significant operational and financial risks, including difficulties in accurately billing for services, potential for delayed or uncollected payments due to undefined payment terms, and persistent disputes over charges when limits are exceeded. The reliance on an external Memorandum of Understanding introduces administrative complexity and potential for conflict. There is also a risk of revenue leakage for services provided beyond 'no charge' limits if no clear charging mechanism is established, leading to financial uncertainty and impacting cash flow.
results.suggested_correction: This cost model shall apply unless superseded by a signed Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) specifying otherwise. Workstations shall be charged at $525/year and Mobile Devices shall be charged at $525/year. Printers shall be No Charge for up to one printer per workstation; additional printers shall be charged at the standard annual device rate of $525. Multi-function Devices shall be No Charge for up to one multi-function device per workstation; additional multi-function devices shall be charged at the standard annual device rate of $525. Invoices for all applicable charges shall be issued annually in advance and are due thirty (30) days from the invoice date. Devices added mid-year shall be prorated on a monthly basis based upon the applicable annual service charge for each device.
results.justification: The clause primarily outlines a cost model and proration methodology, which clearly falls under the classification of 'Payment Terms'. However, it presents several material weaknesses that cumulatively result in significant legal and commercial exposure. The explicit deferral to an existing Memorandum of Understanding (MOU) creates a primary dependency that can lead to uncertainty or disputes if the MOU is not consistently maintained or readily accessible, potentially superseding the agreed cost model. A critical enforceability gap exists due to the complete absence of fundamental payment mechanics; the clause specifies costs but fails to define invoicing triggers, payment due dates, or any consequences for late payments. This omission fundamentally undermines the enforceability of payment obligations and creates substantial financial uncertainty for the party expecting payment. Furthermore, while the clause specifies 'no charge' limits for printers and multi-function devices, it remains ambiguous regarding the applicable charges if these limits are exceeded, which is a significant commercial hole in a cost model. While proration for mid-year additions is mentioned, the specific calculation details are not elaborated, which could lead to minor disputes over amounts. The cumulative effect of these omissions and ambiguities creates a significant imbalance, heavily favoring the service recipient by leaving key payment obligations undefined and exposing the service provider to substantial financial risk and administrative burden in collecting revenue. The reconciled risk score of 6.5 reflects these significant enforceability gaps and commercial ambiguities, which are beyond minor drafting weaknesses and directly impact the certainty and recoverability of charges, placing it at the higher end of moderate risk, bordering on high due to the missing core payment terms.

contract_text:
Service Level Agreement
and
Northwestern IT
Contents
1.0 Service Level Agreement Overview ................................................................................................... 3
2.0 Business Service Description ............................................................................................................. 3
3.0 Agreement Period .............................................................................................................................. 4
4.0 Maintenance ...................................................................................................................................... 4
5.0 Northwestern IT Responsibilities ....................................................................................................... 4
6.0 Customer Responsibilities .................................................................................................................. 8
7.0 Assumptions ...................................................................................................................................... 9
8.0 Requesting Support ........................................................................................................................... 9
8.1 Incident Response and Resolution Times.......................................................................................... 10
8.2 Service Request Response and Resolution Times .............................................................................. 10
8.4 Service Desk Metrics ........................................................................................................................ 11
8.6 Ongoing breach in service level ........................................................................................................ 11
9.0 Priority of service requests ............................................................................................................... 11
10.0 Amendments or Termination.......................................................................................................... 11
11.0 Support Outside of this Agreement ................................................................................................. 12
12.0 Billing Information ........................................................................................................................ 12
13.0 Cost of Agreement ..................................................................................................................................... 12
1.0 Service Level Agreement Overview
This document is a Service Level Agreement between Northwestern IT (service provider)
and the (customer), outlining the provisioning of IT services.
The purpose of this agreement is to establish service expectations, identify provider and
consumer responsibilities related to this service, specify how this service is supported, and
clarify service charges.
2.0 Business Service Description
Northwestern IT (NUIT) agrees to provide Endpoint device management and support as a
service to customer.
NUIT will: provide
• Device deployment – Procurement, Custom factory image loading including
enterprise licensed common applications, asset tagging and labelling, pre-delivery
and staging services, and system installation, system configuration and data
migrations. Delivers and installs your fully integrated systems to customer
designated user locations.
• Secure endpoint management - pre-configuration of security solutions and
installation of antivirus, data encryption and data backup solutions. Regular
application of Operating system and application software patches.
• Device Management - Agent monitoring to ensure proper tracking of device
lifecycle
• NUIT Service Desk - represents the entry point and first-touch support process for
all hardware and software service-related requests. NUIT delivers a strategic,
customized full-featured service desk that is driven by the goals of quality, value,
and customer satisfaction. NUIT service desk is accountable to resolve, track,
escalate and follow-up on all Endpoint systems related issues that affect customer
productivity.
• NUIT provides on-site Field Services support for endpoint systems, software, and
peripherals support. We assist with installations, moves, adds and changes, as well
as everyday hardware and peripheral support services.
Authorized service delivery providers will be dispatched to your End User when
hardware, software, or peripheral problems cannot be resolved remotely.
• Disposition and redeployment– NUIT delivers efficient, secure and simple
processes for data recoveries to disposals and refreshes. Ensures that system data
is destroyed for security purposes. Disposal of Assets and manages Employee
Purchase Programs.
3.0 Agreement Period
The period of this agreement is September 1, 2019 through August 30, 2020. Each year,
this agreement will automatically extend for one calendar year unless it is modified or
terminated as described in this document.
4.0 Maintenance
Maintenance of services provided in this agreement will be conducted in accordance with
established NUIT Change Management practices, and will occur during scheduled service
maintenance windows. Emergency maintenance, in response to service outages, may
occur with no advanced notice to service consumers. Maintenance or outages of other,
underlying or integrated, services may impact the services provided in this agreement.
Notification of service maintenance and outages is available at:
Service Status (https://service-status.northwestern.edu/).
Information on how to subscribe to email service alerts can be found at:
https://service-status.northwestern.edu/
5.0 Northwestern IT Responsibilities
The following list specifies responsibilities of NUIT related to providing the service set
forth in this agreement. Northwestern IT will be responsible for the following:
Workstations (desktop and laptop computers)
• Build workstations
Install one of NUIT approved computer images
o
 Dual booting or machines with multiple operating systems will be
assessed and approved by the Technology Support Services Director on
a case by case basis based on business, research or teaching need.
Install additional software and or make additional updates to the endpoint
o
device
 Upon request
 Subject to security approval
Include and manage
o
 NUIT’ service automated software updating services (Kace/ JAMF)
 Endpoint security software(Symantec Endpoint Protection)
 Whole disk encryption (MBAM and FileVault)
Ensure desired work space has functional electrical and network access
o
 Make recommendations for electrical or network access and advise
CONDUITS and FM ordering processes.
Purchase, deliver and install workstation in desired work space
o
Troubleshooting wired or wireless network connectivity users, escalating to
o
TNS has required.
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required
o
 Coordinate with Dell, Lenovo/CDWG for services (PCs)
 Coordinate with Apple service technician (MACs)
Provide temporary loaner computer
o
 Upon request
 If operationally necessary
 Subject to availability
Conference room and classroom support
o
 Coordinate with Northwestern IT Audio/Visual team as need for
support issue
• Provide departmental fiscal office with semi-annual refresh notifications for
workstations.
• Assist with providing purchasing recommendations for new or replacement computers
• Provide major OS updates as required for vendor support (e.g. Windows “Creator
Updates”, MacOS 10.X point releases)
• Provide disposition of end-of-life devices
Scrub data and remove hard drive
o
Send devices to Northwestern University Surplus and/or donate to Student
o
Enrichment Services
Mobile Devices
The following support is offered upon request:
• Make purchasing recommendations for Northwestern University owned mobile device
• Configure mobile devise
• Configure email
• Coordinate activities with 3rd party vendors as required (University owned devices
only)
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required (University owned devices only)
o
Printers
The following support is offered upon request:
• Set up printers
• Organize for disposal of printers
OU Administration (CampusAD)
The following support is offered upon request:
• Add new users to CampusAD
• Create CampusAD accounts
• Grant access to resources control via CampusAD
• Delete users
• Manage Group Policies
Endpoint Management Services
Management of the following endpoint management software’s:
• Workstations will be patched no less than monthly for OS and application by use of
management software, including Kace, JAMF
• Full system backup of device including local machine stored data using Crashplan
Monitoring of backup services will be provided, with either tickets generated
o
or user notification provided in the event that backups are not functioning
Box
The following support is offered upon request:
• Install Box client software, such as Box Edit, Drive and Sync
• Facilitate the creation of organization shares and group accounts
Multi-function devices
The following support is offered upon request:
• Configure printing and scanning access to a multi-function device.
• Address user observed errors upon notification
Conduct troubleshooting and remediation efforts
o
Coordinate warranty work as required
o
Installation and Troubleshooting of customer specific software
The following support is offered upon request:
• Northwestern IT will install all customer specific software and will work with the
user/experts in said software to ensure that the installation of these applications does not
destabilize other desktop or application functionality
• NUIT will work with the user/experts to contact the vendor of said software to
accomplish same, but will not act independently of the user/experts in contacting
vendors.
Out of Scope
The following services are explicitly not offered in this SLA.
• Management of personal devices
• Support for unmanaged devices such as servers, customer purchased devices
New Technology
Both Northwestern IT and the customer recognize that new technology adoption is
important to the mission of the university. The customer may be introduced or considered
for adoption during the course of this Agreement. At the mutual agreement of the NUIT
and the customer, joint testing, demonstration, or evaluation of such technology may be
undertaken.
If the customer adopts a new computing technology and desires that NUIT support it, then
the Customer Contact will consult with the TSS. If they agree that the new technology
has a limited effect on support time for the support personnel, then it will be incorporated
into the current support activities. Otherwise, the Customer Contact will follow the
procedure described in the section entitled “Support Outside of this Agreement”.
Computer Support Policies
Northwestern IT will support the University-owned computers of the customer based on
the following policies:
1. New purchases must meet the Northwestern IT recommended standards. New
purchases will be set up with the NUIT software image.
2. Existing computer hardware must meet the minimum hardware and operating system
standards.
3. Support level will be determined by the age of the machine
Computer Age Support level Support description
0-4 years Full Support Northwestern IT will ensure the working order of the
computer, using reasonable staff time and support
resources
